intro: Heterocoma gracilis, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Heterocoma gracilis is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient environments.
